summary: This bill, the International Trafficking Victims Protection Reauthorization Act of 2025, reauthorizes and amends the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000. It focuses on combating human trafficking abroad by integrating anti-trafficking efforts into multilateral development banks, modifying foreign assistance policies, and clarifying non-humanitarian, nontrade-related assistance. The bill also expands protections for domestic workers of diplomatic personnel, extends authorization of appropriations for related programs, and mandates briefings on the annual Trafficking in Persons Report and the use of waivers.
